text: Happy World Teacher's Day to all the incredible educators in #MD03 and nationwide. Thank you for all you do to empower, shape and uplift the next generation of leaders and change makers.

Since day one, @POTUS has taken historic action to address the student debt crisis & make college more attainable. I applaud today’s announcement of forgiveness for 125,000 borrowers, which brings the total Americans receiving student loan relief under this admin to nearly 3.6M.

Due to his failure to demand accountability for those who sought to undermine our democracy on January 6th and his refusal to uphold the bipartisan budget agreement that Congress reached earlier this year, I voted to remove Kevin McCarthy as Speaker of the House.
The people of Maryland’s Third Congressional District elected me to represent their best interests in Congress and their best interests are not served by Kevin McCarthy’s leadership.

No community is untouched by the mental health crisis. This #MentalIllnessAwarenessWeek, check in on yourself and the people you care about and learn the warning signs of a mental health condition here: nami.org/About-Mental-Illnes…

Last year alone, around 9 million seniors and other beneficiaries spent $3.4 billion in out-of-pocket costs on just these ten drugs. Now, thanks to @POTUS and Congressional Democrats, we are holding Big Pharma accountable and lowering costs for seniors and families.

While I am pleased this likely means we will avert a shutdown, we must work in a bipartisan manner to fund government programs for the remainder of Fiscal Year 2024 and uphold our moral commitment to democracy and to the world by providing critical assistance to Ukraine.

The chaos of the last few days didn’t have to happen. It was a crisis manufactured by House Republicans. A shutdown would have been disastrous for MD and for our country. I supported this short term CR today so we can keep the government open and running for the American people.
PSA: student loan payments resume tomorrow. If you have questions about what this means for you, head to studentaid.gov and don’t forget to see if you qualify for @POTUS’ new SAVE plan.

I urge Speaker McCarthy to bring clean, bipartisan stopgap funding legislation to the floor that delivers for the American people, not an extreme faction of his party.
Congress must focus on passing pragmatic legislation to prevent the devastating impact a shutdown would have on our constituents.

I am willing to work with anyone – Democrat or Republican – to avoid a devastating government shutdown. However, I cannot support a proposal that implements draconian cuts and harmful policies that will threaten the health, safety and economic security of people in #MD03.
This is not a solution to keep the government running, but yet another political stunt that is dead on arrival in the Senate. Service members, federal workers and American families deserve better.

I voted no on House Republicans’ extreme stopgap funding legislation, which would slash vital programs and services, adopt an immigration policy at odds with our nation’s values and could threaten the future of Social Security and Medicare.

Once again, House Republicans are failing the American people. Even now, at the eleventh hour, they are continuing to recklessly advance their far-right agenda instead of keeping the government open and providing for those we are elected to serve.

Senator Feinstein was a giant among us. Throughout her 30+ years in the Senate, she broke barriers for women in politics, championed the fundamental values of our democracy & was a model of dedication to public service with too many firsts to count. May her memory be a blessing.

G’mar Chatima Tovah. Wishing everyone observing Yom Kippur in #MD03 and across the country a blessed fast and meaningful period of reflection.

With over 500 mass shootings in 2023 alone, it’s clear we need bold, historic action to address the gun violence epidemic in our communities. I applaud @POTUS and @VP’s commitment to saving lives and confronting this issue head-on.

I’m proud to have played a role in passing this legislation which reclaims American leadership in manufacturing, science & innovation – bolstering our economic prosperity, equipping a resilient workforce & placing us on the forefront of unlocking the discoveries of the future.

In communities nationwide, 
the bill’s investments are creating good-paying jobs, boosting American manufacturing and helping us fight climate change & secure a clean energy future – proving yet again that our economic, national security & environmental goals can be met together.
In the year since the CHIPS and Science Act’s enactment, we are already feeling the impact of this legislation.

When the COVID-19 pandemic revealed supply chain weaknesses that disrupted our public health and economic recovery, Congress passed the bipartisan CHIPS and Science Act: a once-in-a-generation investment in American competitiveness.

After Americans showed up & showed out to protect their democracy, Congress passed the Inflation Reduction Act - historic climate legislation that stood up to polluters and demanded a greener future. We must keep working together to implement this law & build on its progress.

When Americans vote, they make a statement about the policies and future they want to see - & overwhelmingly they want a cleaner future. By rooting out polluters' dark money & ensuring these voices are heard, we'll create a healthier democracy & world for generations to come.

The Freedom to Vote Act & John R. Lewis Voting Rights Act work together to expand access to the ballot box, end partisan gerrymandering & combat big money in politics. These are commonsense measures voters of all political stripes can call on their elected officials to support.

SCOTUS’ Shelby decision opened the floodgates to Republican-led voter suppression laws nationwide – with 322 introduced in 2023 alone. It’s critical to push back at the state level while updating & strengthening federal protections to ensure every American's freedom to vote.

Onerous registration requirements, inadequate polling locations, a lack of early or mail-in voting, and voter purging are just some of the obstacles designed and intentionally deployed to make it harder for predominantly minority or low-income communities to vote.

Born of the civil rights movement, the VRA is a landmark law that builds on the constitutional promise of equal protection under law & the right to vote by prohibiting racial discrimination in voting – safeguarding every American’s right to have a voice in their democracy.

In July, we reintroduced the Freedom to Vote Act to build a freer, fairer, more equitable #DemocracyForAll.

I’m joining @LCVoters on August 8th at 3 PM ET for a Twitter Q&A on why legislation like this is critical to fulfill the promise of our representative government.

#OTD in 1965, Congress passed the #VotingRightsAct - a landmark achievement of the civil rights movement that has fundamentally strengthened our democracy. Today, we remain committed to building on its progress and passing legislation to ensure every American’s freedom to vote.

The #FreedomtoVoteAct:
 
✅Ensures free and fair access to the ballot
✅Protects the integrity of our elections
✅Prohibits partisan gerrymandering
✅Ends the era of big money in our politics
 
& more to create a democracy that works for all Americans.
